skill.name: dnanexus-integration
skill.description: DNAnexus cloud genomics platform. Build apps/applets, manage data (upload/download), dxpy Python SDK, run workflows, FASTQ/BAM/VCF, for genomics pipeline development and execution.
skill.summary: DNAnexus cloud genomics platform. Build apps/applets, manage data (upload/download), dxpy Python SDK...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: All 455 static findings are false positives. The skill is documentation for DNAnexus cloud genomics platform. The flagged 'external_commands' are legitimate DNAnexus CLI commands (dx, dxpy) in documentation code blocks. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' findings incorrectly identified API version fields like 'dxapi: 1.0.0' as cryptographic code. The 'Windows SAM database' alert misidentified authentication documentation (DX_SECURITY_CONTEXT) as Windows system files. No malicious patterns exist.

content.value_statement: DNAnexus provides cloud-based genomics analysis but requires platform-specific knowledge. This skill offers complete documentation for building apps, managing data, and running bioinformatics workflows.
actual_capabilities: Build and deploy DNAnexus apps and applets with dx-toolkit
Manage genomic data uploads and downloads using dxpy SDK
Create multi-step bioinformatics workflows and pipelines
Search and organize FASTQ, BAM, and VCF files
Configure dxapp.json for app dependencies and Docker containers
limitations: Requires active DNAnexus account and API credentials
Genomics-specific platform for sequence analysis workflows
Bioinformatics domain knowledge needed for effective pipeline design

use_cases.title: Process sequencing data pipeline
use_cases.description: Upload FASTQ files, run alignment and variant calling workflows, download results for research analysis

use_cases.title: Build custom analysis apps
use_cases.description: Create DNAnexus apps for specialized genomics analyses with proper input and output handling

use_cases.title: Organize genomic datasets
use_cases.description: Search, categorize, and manage large genomic datasets across multiple DNAnexus projects

prompt_templates.title: Upload and analyze FASTQ
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me upload a FASTQ file to DNAnexus and run a basic quality control analysis using an existing applet

prompt_templates.title: Create alignment app
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to create a DNAnexus app that takes FASTQ input and outputs BAM alignment using BWA-MEM

prompt_templates.title: Batch process samples
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to find all FASTQ files in a project and run the same analysis on each in parallel

prompt_templates.title: Configure complex dependencies
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me configure dxapp.json for an app that needs samtools, bcftools, and a custom Docker image with reference genomes

output_examples.input: How do I upload a FASTQ file and run quality control?
output: 2. Upload your file: dx upload sample.fastq --project project-xxxx
3. Find a QC applet: dx find_applets --name '*qc*'
4. Run analysis: dx run applet-xxxx -i reads=file-yyyy

output_examples.input: Create a simple app that filters reads by quality
output: Define dxapp.json with inputSpec for reads file and outputSpec for filtered reads
Use @dxpy.entry_point('main') decorator for the main function
Process with subprocess.call() to external tool

best_practices: Always validate input files before processing in DNAnexus apps
Use appropriate DNAnexus instance types for compute-intensive analyses
Include comprehensive error handling and logging in custom apps
anti_patterns: Hardcoding project IDs or file paths in production apps
Processing large files without checking available disk space
Ignoring DNAnexus job states and error conditions

faq.question: What file formats does DNAnexus support?
faq.answer: DNAnexus supports common genomics formats: FASTQ, BAM, VCF, BED, GFF, and custom formats through file objects

faq.question: How do I authenticate with DNAnexus?
faq.answer: Use dx login command or set DX_SECURITY_CONTEXT environment variable with your authentication token

faq.question: Can I run existing command-line tools?
faq.answer: Yes, package them in apps with execDepends or Docker images, then call via subprocess in Python apps

faq.question: What is the difference between apps and applets?
faq.answer: Applets are project-specific for development. Apps are versioned, shareable executables across projects

faq.question: How do I handle large datasets efficiently?
faq.answer: Use parallel job execution, appropriate instance types, and consider data locality when designing workflows

faq.question: Can I integrate with external databases?
faq.answer: Yes, DNAnexus apps have internet access. Use APIs or download reference data during execution
